keywords.value: CIVIL WAR (THE WAR BETWEEN THE STATES)

docs.snippet: There is a very natural anxiety to know all about the antecedents of those who are to be the leaders of the Grand Army of the United States in the pending contest, and below we give brief sketches of the Generals recently appointed:

headline.main: THE NEW MAJOR-GENERALS.; Sketches of the Career of Gens McClellan, Butler, Banks, Fremont, and of Brigadier-General Lyon. MAJOR-GEN J.C. FREMONT. MAJOR-GENRAL N.P. BANKS. BRIG. GEN. B.F. BUTLER. BRIGADIER-GENERAL NATHANIEL LYON.

docs.lead_paragraph: There is a very natural anxiety to know all about the antecedents of those who are to be the leaders of the Grand Army of the United States in the pending contest, and below we give brief sketches of the Generals recently appointed:

docs.snippet: It is evident from the tenor of our advices from Washington this morning, that the Government is about to make another important forward movement into Virginia, but in what direction, is of course, known only to those who direct.
docs.lead_paragraph: It is evident from the tenor of our advices from Washington this morning, that the Government is about to make another important forward movement into Virginia, but in what direction, is of course, known only to those who direct.

headline.main: LOCAL MILITARY MOVEMENTS.; DEPARTURE OF THE SECOND MAINE REGIMENT. APPEAL OF THE FIFTY-FIFTH REGIMENT. COL. WILSON'S ZOUAVES. COL. KEERIGAN'S REGIMENT. THIRD REGIMENT-COL. TOWNSEND. DEATH OF A CAPTAIN OF VOLUNTEERS. PRESENTATION OF COLORS TO FIRST REGIMENT SCOTT LIFE GUARD. COMMISSARY'S DEPARTMENT. A NATIONAL FLAG PRESENTED TO THE SEVENTYNINTH REGIMENT. ANDERSON ZOUAVES. This Regiment goes into quarters to-day at SNED IKER'S, on Long Island. Four hundred men leave for the barracks to-day, three hundred to-morrow, and the balance the next day. THE SANDY HOOK ENCAMPMENT. THE PRIZE COMMISSIONERS.

headline.main: LOCAL MILITARY MOVEMENTS.; RETURN OF THE SANITARY COMMITTEE FROM WASHINGTON.

docs.snippet: Gov. BURTON, of Delaware, has issued a proclamation, calling out a three years' regiment to serve under the Government. All volunteers are to report themselves to Capt. WHARTON, at Wilmington.
docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. BURTON, of Delaware, has issued a proclamation, calling out a three years' regiment to serve under the Government. All volunteers are to report themselves to Capt. WHARTON, at Wilmington.

docs.snippet: The latest advices from Harper's Ferry state that there are 10,000 troops in town and at Bolivar, and about 400 on the Maryland Heights, but the latter have no field pieces.

headline.main: REPORTS FROM HARPER'S FERRY AND HAGERSTOWN.

docs.lead_paragraph: The latest advices from Harper's Ferry state that there are 10,000 troops in town and at Bolivar, and about 400 on the Maryland Heights, but the latter have no field pieces.
